snippet: Separatist fighters had besieged a border guard command center in Luhansk for two days. A nearby internal security base was also overrun.
abstract: Ukrainian guards, near Russian border in eastern Ukraine, flee their posts for fear of attacks by separatist militias, helping open strategic corridor for transport of goods, contraband and war material from Russia that could lead to a widening of conflict in eastern Ukraine.

byline.original: By SABRINA TAVERNISE and SERGEY PONOMAREV
byline.contributor: Sabrina Tavernise reported from Chervonopartizansk, and Sergey Ponomarev from Belovodsk, Ukraine. David M. Herszenhorn contributed reporting from Moscow, and Andrew Roth from Krasny Liman, Ukraine.

lead_paragraph: Separatist fighters had besieged a border guard command center in Luhansk for two days. A nearby internal security base was also overrun.

headline.main: Border Guards in Ukraine Abandon Posts
headline.print_headline: Border Guards in Ukraine Abandon Posts
